name: Hilton London Stansted Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where do I start? Pathetic service, our confirmed non-smoking room was a smoking room, no facecloths and one hand towel, sand in the bed, and the toilet flushed sometimes. NEVER AGAIN! Many hostels are better. My impression of Hilton Hotels is tarnished.
reviews.title: Regretted staying here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here several years ago, but only recently signed up. Had a double room booked for 55 pounds for a night, which was great. Proximity to Stansted was an absolute bonus, as we arrived from Australia at Heathrow (via Taipei/Bangkok/Amsterdam - a 40 hour flight with no time outside airports) at 5pm, with a 6am Stansted flight the next day. Top marks for the shuttle bus as well.
reviews.title: Possibly needs rebranding...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby befitted a five-star hotel chain, with friendly and efficient staff. However, the rooms themselves, although definitely comfortable, were not up to a "Hilton" standard. Considering what we paid, this wasn't a problem; but it was more of a travelodge level rather than a hilton level. Our room also had no mini bar, which was something I have not encountered before or since in any situation, to my knowledge. The beds were extremely comfortable though, and requesting feather pillows was definitely a smart idea. Good sized rooms, although again maybe not to a "classic" Hilton size.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in

likes.liked: — Leaving to get out of it
likes.disliked: — I have sen better quality slums

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Extras were expensive, even for chain hotels/airport hotels. Their business centre set me back a small fortune just to send a couple of e-mails, and a quick 3 minute phone call to Australia. Room service was also incredibly expensive, although it must be noted, of a good quality. The internet in the room was ineffective and did not work.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool, steam room and sauna were superb - no complaints there at all! Best way to unwind from a flight. We intended to use the gym facilities too, but as the gym is one also open to the public the amenities were constantly full.
reviews.title: Perfectly fine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Terrible Hotel - definitely NOT Hilton quality, but more like a run down motel. The mattresses in our room were old and lumpy, and my husband and I both had backaches the next day. Cleanliness was substandard and the noise was unbelievable, with doors slamming all night long. We had a 7 hour flight to the US the next day, and had to cram onto a "cattle car" bus to the airport, since they only run every half hour. Also, they charged us 2 pounds each (equivalent to $8 US) to get to the airport. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. We stayed at Hiltons all over Europe, and this is nothing more than a cheap motel. The airport is over 10 minutes away also, once you board the bus.
reviews.title: Run Down Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Terrible experience - not a great way to end a trip.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.text: Pleasant and helpful staff. Decided to eat in the Restaurant - good selection of dishes all served with friendly banter from the amiable Chef. Service with a smile from the waiting staff. This is in extreme contrast to the Warwick Hilton were I stayed on business a few days before - see my review!!
reviews.title: Exemplary Housekeeping

reviews.text: Hotel showing a few signs of wear and tear as I expect it has a very high throughput of guests. Rooms small but clean.
reviews.title: Convenient and welcoming

likes.liked: — Hotel offers good value for money, with exceptionally pleasant and helpful staff
likes.disliked: — Well-worn, and in need of upgrading

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was easy to park this time - I had significant problems last Sept' and had to park on a grass verge.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel offers a shuttle to and from the airport which is nice. The rooms were good size for the London area and offers a pool and fitness area. The dining area was a bit pompous but the food wasn't bad. Its a good place to stay for overnight visit while waiting for a plane.
reviews.title: good hotel for an overnight stay

reviews.text: This hotel is a disgrace to the HIlton brand.
reviews.title: Hilton Disgrace

reviews.text: The hotel will try and rip the most out of you after you have checked in.
reviews.title: Buses to airport every half hour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The hotel charges GBP2.50 to call a freecall number. I have never come across this at any hotel/ or Hilton hotels. (The hotel called this a connection fee). I felt ripped off.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. The meals at the restaurant/ room serice are very pricey. Not that tastey neither. Felt not value for money.
reviews.title: room was a bit tired looking

reviews.text: I'm amazed this hotel can stay compeditive at the prices it charges. There is a hotel right beside the terminal in Stansted airport which is comparable in price but of much higher quality than this remote option.
reviews.title: Overpriced in the extreme

reviews.text: There is a shuttle bus service running from the airport, it takes 5 mins approx, but be warned, they have the cheek to charge for the return journey - £2!!!
reviews.title: Appalling

reviews.text: The decor in the public areas and the rooms is old and tired. The shower bracket in my room was broken. Even at full temperature on the dial, the room wasn't warm enough for me. I had food in the bar, which was phenominally expensive given the basic nature of it. I ordered burger and chips, it was well and truelly average and no more. The clincher for me was that I had a glass of house dry white wine which cost £7, genuinely I'm not exagerrating.
reviews.title: Remote

reviews.text: The hotel at the terminal is also very expensive but generally delivers a much better service in every department, no question.
reviews.title: Good airport hotel let down by slow check in and ££££££ restau

likes.disliked: — Overpriced restau, lack of family room, slow check-in, muddled reservations

reviews.title: No problems
reviews.text: This hotel is a disgrace to the Hilton brand. Rooms are old and shabby and the corridoors and hotel room doors are more akin to a boarding school. The staff while friendly were poorly trained. Took us 15 minutes to check into two rooms. And then when I went up to my room I walked in on somebody else. They had double booked the room. Needless to say I was not too happy. Eventually got a room but was tired and cranky at that stage. The air conditioning in the room was outdated and noisy.

aka: Hilton London Stansted Airport Hotel Stansted
description: Enjoy travel convenience at the Hilton London Stansted Airport Hotel, situated within the perimeter of the airport. This airport hotel provides parking for hotel Guests who need to catch an early morning flight and prefer to take the bus transfer for the six-minute ride to the airport terminal. Central London is just 30 minutes by train from this hotel and only three miles from the busy market town of Bishop Stortford.Discover the West End’s famous theatres, galleries, shopping and nightlife, only an hour away by train. The Imperial War Museum, Hatfield Country Park and Mountfitchet Castle are easily accessible from this airport location.Start the day with a Hilton Buffet breakfast at Amy’s Restaurant. Sample the Hilton a la carte menu or dine on international cuisine with family and friends. Choose from a wide selection of wines and whiskeys and unwind in an armchair in the welcoming atmosphere of Amy’s Bar. Relax with friends in the informal Costa Coffee, enjoying a favorite coffee or tea with a light snack.Swim laps in the indoor pool and work out in the fully equipped 24-hour fitness center before unwinding in the steam room, sauna and Jacuzzi®. Stay connected in the business center with high-speed internet access and contemporary business facilities. Host meetings and events for 2-250 guests in one of 16 versatile meeting rooms with WiFi.
